revised_title: X-ray Studies of Thermal Cycles in the Transformation of Potassium Cyanide
tldr: The authors conducted X-ray diffraction studies on single crystals of potassium cyanide to investigate its thermal transformation. They discovered that the transformation occurs gradually over a temperature range, and hybrid single crystals with co-existing domains of different structures form during the process. The results provide insights into the understanding of continuous thermodynamic transformations in solids.
